document_title: Peripheral neuropathy: Causes, symptoms and treatments
subsection_content:
The best way to prevent peripheral neuropathy is to control its causes, such as diabetes, alcoholism or rheumatoid arthritis. Besides, people need to practice a healthy lifestyle including:
Eat a diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains and lean proteins to keep the nerves healthy.; Fight vitamin B-12 deficiency by eating meat, fish, eggs, low-fat dairy foods, and fortified cereals. If you are vegetarian or vegan, fortified cereals are a good source of vitamin B-12, but you can also talk to your doctor about taking vitamin B-12 pills.; Exercise regularly, at least 30 minutes - 1 hour/each session and exercise at least 3 times/week.; Avoid factors that can cause nerve damage, including repetitive movements, cramped positions that put pressure on the nerves, exposure to toxic chemicals, smoking, and drinking too much alcohol.
